meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the outer layer of cells in an embryo
meanings.sent1: The ectomeric cells play a crucial role in early development.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the ectomeric layer to understand embryonic growth.
meanings.sent3: The ectomeric cells decided to throw a party to celebrate their uniqueness.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright and ectomeric as the morning sun.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a vivid picture of the ectomeric layer with intricate detail.

meanings.definition: A substance that is derived from the outer layer of cells in an embryo
meanings.sent1: The researchers discovered a new ectomeric with potential medical applications.
meanings.sent2: The ectomeric was extracted carefully to preserve its properties.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a pinch of ectomeric to the recipe for a unique flavor twist.
meanings.sent4: Her perfume had a hint of ectomeric, giving it a fresh and youthful scent.
meanings.sent5: The lotion contained ectomeric, known for its nourishing effects on the skin.
